title: As a tank player, this imbalance has always irked me.....
body:
When you roll into a game as a tank, your secret goal is to become a Raid boss.  Maybe you won't do the most damage, but you sure as hell wont die either.  When the game starts you evaluate the build path to best become that raid boss. Lets give some examples
Enemy: {{champion:92}} {{champion:421}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:15}} {{champion:43}} 
I see a pretty heavy AD comp right there, makes my build path easy as pie. I mean look at all my choices of great armor items:
{{item:3742}} {{item:3110}} {{item:3025}} {{item:3047}} {{item:3143}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3075}} {{item:3512}} I mean i actually have to make choices!
Now lets flip it to a recent game i had.
Enemy: {{champion:68}} {{champion:90}}  {{champion:103}} {{champion:42}} {{champion:143}} 
Now if that is not the most AP dmg heavy team in the world I don't know what is. Time to figure out my build!
{{item:3111}} {{item:3065}} Fantastic start! I guess {{item:3102}} would be good, a little low on HP but it give me a decent amount of MR to compensate. 
Uhoh....... now what do i build? {{item:3001}} {{item:3174}} Ap mid laner items, not tank top items.  {{item:3060}}  {{item:3222}}  {{item:3190}} Mainly support items, especially since the amount of MR and HP they get are pretty abysmal.  {{item:3156}} {{item:3139}} Im not an ADC or Hard AD carry either. {{item:3091}} this couldnt be a more useless (Extremely niche pick on niche champions.   {{item:3512}} This item is a little past its prime, but still holds a place in a heart or 2, still not an S+ MR item. {{item:3026}} Anyone else tired that this item is picked so often now? especially for how cheap it is. 

Final tally, youve got about 3 good choices in {{item:3111}} {{item:3102}} {{item:3065}} And then more than likely the support is building a {{item:3105}} item. 
We got a mage item update, could we get some MR item update planned for the next preseason at least? This needs more choices

http://www.auplod.com/u/plduoa78653.png Out

But you're missing the point here. Obviously there is a more pressing need for armor. Every team comp ever has an adc, and if you don't build armor against a fed adc, you just lose. However, this does not excuse the MR meta from becoming stale. Currently, there are 2 tank MR items, and if you really need a lot of mr, you will just mindlessly get both of them. Let's do an example. We'll use my main, amumu (base armor at level 18 = 88.1, we round to 88 for convenience, http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/List_of_champions'_armor).

My standard rune and mastery set gives me 9 bonus armor and 5% bonus armor/mr and my standard build is as follows:
{{item:1410}} {{item:3047}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3001}} {{item:3116}} 6th item is flex, lets ignore that for now. 
My total armor from this build is 88 + 9 + 30 + 50 = 177 x  1.05 = 179.5 ~ **180**
Of this 180 total armor, 88 is base, and 92 is bonus.

Now let's move onto the penetration stats:
{{item:3071}} (max 30% armor shred): 180 x .70 = 126 total armor, of which **only 38 is bonus armor** (126 - 88 = 38)

{{item:3036}}  or {{item:3033}} (45% penetration to BONUS armor): 38 x .45 = 17.1 ~ 17 armor pen

The 7% pen from masteries will still act on the 126 armor stat, as the actual armor value remains unchanged by the LW item, so

126 x 0.07 = 8.82 ~ 9 amor pen.

Now let's figure out the total % of armor ignored.

(126 armor after cleaver shred) - (17 armor from LW item) - (9 armor from mastery) = 100 effective armor

total starting armor was 180, so (100/180) = 55.5 ~  56% of starting armor meaning that max possible armor ignored with items is **44%** NOT 64%.

First of all, Unyielding (the mastery that increases armor) only increases **bonus armor**, so only 89 armor should be taken into consideration in terms of Unyielding.

Total armor should be instead 88 + 9 + 30 + 50 + (89 x 0.05) = 181.45 ≈ 181
Base armor = 88
Bonus armor = 181 - 88 = 93

I don't agree with your way of rounding off because it leads to inaccurate and flawed calculation but for the sake of this piece of maths, I will let it go.

> Now let's move onto the penetration stats:
> {{item:3071}} (max 30% armor shred): 180 x .70 = 126 total armor, of which **only 38 is bonus armor** (126 - 88 = 38)

Second, like I replied to you in a previous post, armor reduction, for instance The Black Cleaver, shreds both base and bonus armor, so if you say the resulting bonus armor is 38. You are very wrong.

For the sake of it, I'll keep the wrong maths in part 1 (calculation for total armor) and use it for part 2 (calculation for resulting armor after armor reduction from The Black Cleaver):

The resultant total armor after the shred of The Black Cleaver (max stacks) = 180 x 0.7 = 126 
The remaining base armor = 88 x 0.7 = 61.6 ≈ 62
The remaining bonus armor = 92 x 0.7 = 64.4 ≈ 64

If we use the right maths in Part 1:
The resultant total armor after the shred of The Black Cleaver (max stacks) = 181  x 0.7 = 126.7 = 127
The remaining base armor = 88 x 0.7 = 61.6 ≈ 62
The remaining bonus armor = 93 x 0.7 = 65.1 ≈ 65

> 
> 126 x 0.07 = 8.82 ~ 9 amor pen.

Third, percentage armor penetration stacks multiplicatively (whether it's total armor penetration or bonus armor penetration), so your maths here are very off.

For the sake of clarity, let's use the correct version of Part 2, shall we?

The remaining base armor after considering all sources of armor penetration (LW upgrade and Battering Blows) = 62 x 0.93 = 57.66 ≈ 58
The remaining bonus armor after considering all sources of armor penetration (LW upgrade and Battering Blows) = 65 x 0.93 x 0.55 = 33.2475 ≈ 33
The resultant total armor  = 58 + 33 = 91

> Now let's figure out the total % of armor ignored.
> 
> (126 armor after cleaver shred) - (17 armor from LW item) - (9 armor from mastery) = 100 effective armor
> 
> total starting armor was 180, so (100/180) = 55.5 ~  56% of starting armor meaning that max possible armor ignored with items is **44%** NOT 64%.

Last but not least, let's find out the true value of total armor ignored (After rounding the numbers off for the millionth time, I doubt it's the truest value but whatever):

Armor reduced and penetrated = 181 - 91 = 90
Percentage of total armor reduced and penetrated = 90 / 181 = 49.723% ≈ 50%

Conclusively around 50% of armor is ignored in total.

As for percentage of base armor reduced and penetrated = (88 - 58) / 88 = 34.090% ≈ 34%
Percentage of bonus armor reduced and penetrated = (93 - 33) / 93 = 64.516%  ≈ 65%

Resistances scale with health, so while it's true that MR itemization is somewhat limited, itemization for a full-fledged tank is still somewhat open depending on how you want to play it. Items can include but are not limited to: {{item:3083}} {{item:3748}} {{item:3030}} {{item:3053}}, and even {{item:3800}}.

Now, I can already tell that you may not be satisfied with these items but here me out. My experience as an avid magic damage-dealer player is that ANY champion with 2 of your 3 mentioned items ({{item:3111}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3102}}) is much MUCH harder to take down. You have to expend your precious cooldowns, and even then you are not rewarded for a kill with a full rotation MOST of the time. It's much harder to take down a magic tank. (at least with my experience)

This gives you more room to expand your versatility. As I've already mentioned, {{item:3083}} is a great choice as it offers lots of HP with scales with your resistances. Titanic, while not a "tank" item per se, gives you the option to split push a little better and not CONSTANTLY having to be chained with the team in order to be useful, allowing you to make better use your of your {{summoner:12}} late game. {{item:3030}} is an underappreciated item, as a tank and wanting to be "full raid boss", having this awesome AoE slow is tremendous in keeping the enemy within your grasp. The same argument for Titanic Hydra can also be argued for Sterak's, except it's more teamfight oriented where that extra shield is HUGE. {{item:3800}} is great for later on in the game, you've already become a tremendous pain to take down, and so while you MAY have been taken down via a myriad of spells, your friends are swiftly approaching with a awesome speed boost ready to take advantage of the situation.

Though I do agree with you, it would be nice to have more options for MR. I'd love to have a version of the old Force of Nature back.
